item.title: 美国家庭面临数年最高能源账单，正面临艰难抉择
item.description:
从纽约到弗吉尼亚，居民们正关闭供暖和电力以节省开支，尽管气温已骤降至严寒。【原文：

item.title: 特朗普否决拜登时期向亚利桑那州公用事业公司提供的18亿美元清洁能源贷款
item.description: 美国能源部表示，在对前总统乔·拜登政府时期发放的贷款进行审查后，已取消多项项目，其中包括向亚利桑那州一家公用事业公司提供18亿美元贷款担保以部署清洁能源的项目。【原文：A $1.8 billion loan guarantee to an Arizona utility to deploy clean energy are among the projects the Energy Department has canceled following a review of loans made during former President Joe Biden’s administration, according to the department.】

item.title: 谷歌以60亿美元估值投资特斯拉联合创始人创立的红木资本
item.description: 红木材料公司（Redwood Materials Inc.）在扩大融资轮中新增谷歌母公司字母表公司（Alphabet Inc.）作为投资者，此次融资使这家电池回收与储能初创企业的估值突破60亿美元。【原文：Redwood Materials Inc. added Alphabet Inc.’s Google as an investor in an expanded funding round that values the battery recycling and energy storage startup at more than $6 billion.】

item.title: 美国新增11,300个超快充电器，力图吸引更多电动车主
item.description:
尽管联邦电动汽车激励政策已终止，但更快的充电速度可能促使更多驾驶者转向电动汽车。

【原文：

Faster charging may nudge more drivers to go electric despite the end of federal EV incentives. 

】

item.title: 马德里因罕见降雪关闭部分学校、道路及列车
item.description: 马德里迎来一场突如其来的暴风雪，导致部分学校、道路和铁路线路关闭，空中交通也受到影响。这场名为克里斯汀的暴风雪席卷伊比利亚半岛，让这座不习惯恶劣天气的城市措手不及。【原文：Madrid woke up to a snow flurry that led some schools, roads and train lines to close and the air traffic to slow down in a city that’s not used to inclement weather, as storm Kristin barrels across the Iberian Peninsula.】

item.title: 川崎重工董事长加码液态氢贸易
item.description: 川崎重工业株式会社董事长表示，该公司正推进液态氢供应链计划，印度可能是潜在供应来源。【原文：Kawasaki Heavy Industries Ltd. is moving ahead with plans for a liquefied hydrogen supply chain, with India as a potential source, according to its chairman.】

item.title: SK创新称与福特终止电池合作致其损失26亿美元
item.description: SK创新公司表示，终止与福特汽车公司在美国的电池合资项目导致3.7万亿韩元（约合26亿美元）资产损失，全球电动汽车扩张计划的收缩成本正波及整个供应链。【原文：SK Innovation Co. said the termination of a battery joint venture with Ford Motor Co. in the US resulted in a 3.7 trillion won ($2.6 billion) asset loss, as the cost of a pullback in global electric vehicle ambitions ripples through the supply chain.】

item.title: 中国四年能源扩张规模已超越整个美国电网
item.description: 中国正掀起一场前所未有的能源建设热潮，北京方面力图确保为那些对电力需求旺盛的设施提供充足供应——这些设施对主导未来新兴产业至关重要。【原文：China is undertaking an energy-building boom unlike anything the world has ever seen, as Beijing seeks to ensure supply for power-hungry facilities that are key to dominating emerging industries of the future.】

item.title: 中国电动卡车热潮对液化天然气需求构成新威胁
item.description: 中国电动卡车的快速普及——去年其销量首次超越燃油车——正威胁着该国化石燃料供应商的关键需求来源。【原文：China’s rapid adoption of electric trucks — which overtook gas-powered vehicle sales for the first time last year — is threatening a key source of demand for the country’s suppliers of the fossil fuel.】

item.title: 随着核能计划推进，印度或将订购更多国产反应堆
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度计划订购第三批本土设计的核反应堆，作为一项雄心勃勃的努力的一部分，旨在以可控成本扩大核电产能。【原文：India is set to order a third fleet of locally designed reactors as part of an ambitious effort to expand nuclear power capacity at a manageable cost, according to people familiar with the plan.】

item.title: 特朗普在支持乙醇的艾奥瓦州推动法案，力促提升E15汽油比例
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普总统公开支持一项立法提案，该提案旨在扩大高乙醇含量E15汽油的销售。此举旨在争取包括爱荷华州农民在内的群体对他的经济政绩的支持。【原文：President Donald Trump threw his support behind a legislative proposal that would expand sales of higher-ethanol E15 gasoline as he looked to build support for his economic record with a crowd that included farmers in Iowa.】

item.title: 加州环保监管机构对卡尼与中国达成的电动汽车协议表示欢迎
item.description:
加拿大同意允许4.9万辆中国电动汽车进入该国，加州空气资源委员会主席表示，此举将推动全球逐步淘汰燃油车的进程。【原文：

Canada’s agreement to allow 49,000 Chinese electric cars into the country bolsters the global effort to phase out gas vehicles, the California Air Resources Board chair said.

】

item.title: 下周美国东部遭遇新一轮冬季风暴袭击的可能性正在上升
item.description: 下周初另一场冬季风暴袭击美国东海岸的可能性正在上升，这将再次考验该地区的电网系统。此前一场更强劲的风暴已导致交通中断并引发大范围停电，该地区仍在从这场风暴中恢复。【原文：The odds that another winter storm will pummel the US East Coast early next week are rising, putting power grids to the test again as the region recovers from a larger system that upended travel and triggered widespread blackouts.】

item.title: 为何停电造成的经济损失比我们想象的更严重
item.description:
一项新分析发现，多数关于美国大停电损失的估算未能充分考虑间接影响和长期影响。【原文：

Most estimates of losses from US blackouts don’t fully account for indirect and longer-term impacts, a new analysis finds. 

】

item.title: 特朗普治下美国如何放弃共同气候行动
item.description: 美国于1月27日正式退出《巴黎协定》。这是特朗普总统第二次退出这项由近200个国家签署的协议。该协定承诺将全球变暖幅度控制在工业革命前水平之上不超过2摄氏度（3.6华氏度），理想情况下控制在1.5摄氏度以内。【原文：The US officially exited the Paris Agreement on Jan. 27. It’s the second time President Donald Trump has pulled out of the pact that commits almost 200 countries to keep global warming to no more than 2C (3.6F), and ideally 1.5C, above pre-industrial levels.】

item.title: 热浪席卷澳网，气温预计将达45摄氏度
item.description: 澳大利亚网球公开赛调整了赛程安排，并启动了高温应对方案。据预报，墨尔本气温将飙升至45摄氏度（113华氏度），且烟雾预计将笼罩整个城市。【原文：The Australian Open tennis tournament rescheduled matches and started extreme heat protocols as temperatures in Melbourne were forecast to soar as high as 45C (113F) and smoke was expected to blanket the city.】

item.title: 中国启动全球最大压缩空气储能电站
item.description: 全球最大的压缩空气储能电站已在中国江苏省投入运营，标志着中国在扩大能源储存以支持绿色转型方面迈出了重要一步。【原文：The world’s largest compressed-air power storage plant has begun operating in central China’s Jiangsu province, marking a major step in the country’s efforts to expand energy storage to support its green transition.】

item.title: 中国太阳能巨头警告：退税政策缩减后需求恐遭重创
item.description: 隆基绿能科技公司表示，中国陷入困境的太阳能行业正面临新一轮动荡，因为计划取消一项关键出口退税政策可能扰乱需求模式。【原文：China’s struggling solar sector faces fresh turbulence as the planned removal of a key export-tax rebate threatens to disrupt demand patterns, according to Longi Green Energy Technology Co.】

item.title: 暴风雪过后严寒来袭，6700万人的供电网络面临风险
item.description: 美国正遭受严寒侵袭，本季迄今最严重的暴风雪虽已趋缓，却使该国最大的电网系统仍处于紧急状态，并为应对创纪录的冬季用电需求而严阵以待。【原文：A deep freeze is gripping the US as the worst storm so far this season winds down, leaving the country’s biggest electric grid in emergency status and bracing for record wintertime demand.】

item.title: 新加坡密切监测烟霾风险，因区域火灾产生的烟雾正向该国飘移
item.description: 新加坡国家环境局表示，该国北部发现与植被火灾相关的热点区域，可能引发烟雾飘散至邻国，目前正处于烟霾警戒状态。【原文：Singapore is on alert for possible haze after hotspots linked to vegetation fires were detected north of the city-state, raising the risk of smoke drifting across borders, according to the National Environment Agency.】

item.description: 从国防和网络安全到基础设施和健康生活，贝伦贝格银行认为，到2026年，可持续发展的赢家将呈现多元化趋势。【原文：From defense and cybersecurity to infrastructure and healthier living, Berenberg Bank sees a widening set of sustainability winners heading into 2026.】

item.description: 意大利政府宣布进入紧急状态，并拨出1亿欧元资金用于修复南部部分地区遭受海啸袭击后的破坏。【原文：Italy’s government declared a state of emergency, unlocking €100 million in funds to help repair damage after a sea storm battered parts of the country’s south.】

item.title: 美国极寒天气重创得州石油生产商与炼油企业
item.description: 上周末席卷美国的强劲冬季风暴重创了石油天然气生产商，以及将这些原材料加工成从汽油到塑料等各类产品的工业设施。【原文：A massive winter storm that swept the US over the weekend crippled oil and gas producers and the industrial plants that refine the raw commodities into everything from gasoline to plastics.】
